title: Rethinking rewards for 2015 Oceania Week
body:
Just a query in regards to the literal exploration to the Nautalis Reef in Moreton Bay, 
and a more substantial rewards for the efforts of the players in Oce community.

As you may be aware Coral Bleaching is a major concern, to the longevity of the Great barrier Reef.
While i love what has happened with the Nautalis statue, i feel as tho i will never get an opportunity to actually see it in the flesh so to speak.

So my thought, for those of us Summoners who managed to get our names on the plaque, I would like to see an effort to some how, enable those sixty odd thousand players, to see the reef for themselves. At no cost, (I purely mean a day out snorkeling the reef, accommodation and travel cost should be at the summoners expense) perhaps a voucher of some kind would be an appropriate method of doing this..

My reasons for suggesting this:

First of all, it would create exposure for the great barrier reef, people will become more aware of the of its struggles, and the more people who know the better off the reef will be and we may have a chance at saving our Beautiful Heritage listed Park..

Second, having people travel to see the Nautalis reef will generate huge income for the local population, in Queensland, not only that but for the Great Barrier Reef as a whole.

I know that for me, if i was in Queensland I wouldn't want to stop at just the Nautalis Reef i would want to continue exploring a significant amount of the reef. In turn more income will be generated for the reef.

and finally and i said this in the beginning, i believe the Australian summoners who made this operation possible deserve a more fitting reward.

And what would be more rewarding than seeing our own handiwork.
it would be inspiring. :)

Please consider this and keep up the good work rito. :) peace

Sincerely,

Kid Rat

replies.body:
Something like this would be pretty sweet but I'd make it a more general effort. For example:

People who play league can get a discount (depending on what kind of deal Riot could possibly strike) for visiting the reef. Might not sound as much but it sounds realistic and people who want to actually see the reef are capable of doing so and it's a friendly nudge from Riot towards the players that want to. 

Love the idea and it would be cool to have something like this happening! it's there now, bet summoners want to see it too! 

- Strawberry {{summoner:31}}

40,000 names on the statue * $50 price to snorkel = cost of $2 million to Riot.

Yeah, can't see them doing that, and I'm being generous with the $50 price tag.

doesnt have to cost riot a cent, they would just have to continue their relationship with the queensland government, 
as they would have to have had extensive conversations with the same people in order to plan the nautalis reef in the first place, just re negotiate some kind of agreement for the players to come visit the site.
the biggest issue i believe is the fact that not even 10% of the 40,000 would have their scuba licences

sure you have valid points, and you could continue to scrutinize the idea and come up with reasons why it would not work.....

in saying that there are plenty of pros to my argument, and it could be a worthy idea given the correct ground work was done

It's going to cost someone, and I can't see the QLD government paying for it, or the local businesses doing it for free. They would still have to provide it for potentially 40,000 people because people may get their scuba license for the dive. 

And 4000 people is still $200,000
